meanings.definition: The quality or state of being collapsible.
meanings.sent1: The collapsibilities of the cardboard boxes made them easy to store.
meanings.sent2: The collapsibilities of the tents allowed for quick assembly and disassembly.
meanings.sent3: The collapsibilities of the inflatable pool made it a fun addition to the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The collapsibilities of the folding chair were put to the test during the family picnic.
meanings.sent5: The collapsibilities of the umbrella made it convenient to carry around on sunny days.

meanings.definition: The potential for something to collapse.
meanings.sent1: The old building showed signs of collapsibilities, so it was deemed unsafe.
meanings.sent2: Engineers assessed the collapsibilities of the bridge before allowing heavy vehicles to pass.
meanings.sent3: The collapsibilities of the Jenga tower added an element of suspense to the game.
meanings.sent4: The collapsibilities of the market were evident during times of economic downturn.
meanings.sent5: The collapsibilities of the sandcastle became apparent as the tide came in.
